ru.tinkoff.decoro

Interface Mask

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Slot>, android.os.Parcelable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MaskImpl

    public interface Mask
extends java.lang.Iterable<Slot>, android.os.Parcelable
    Interface representing a Mask that holds slots with user input and hardcoded data. The mask performs actual formatting of the input and able to return formatted and unformatted string.

    See: MaskImpl - the main implementation of this interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

        android.os.Parcelable.ClassLoaderCreator<T>, android.os.Parcelable.Creator<T>

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

        CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR, PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE

    • Method Detail

      • toUnformattedString

        java.lang.String toUnformattedString()
        Returns:
        mask contents without decoration characters. Decoration characters are specified with Slot.TAG_DECORATION tag on a corresponding Slot

      • getInitialInputPosition

        int getInitialInputPosition()
        Looks for initial position for cursor since buffer can be predefined with starting characters

      • hasUserInput

        boolean hasUserInput()
        Checks whether there're filled out slot except of 'hardcoded' ones. This can happen only if some text was inserted to a mask (e.g. by user input).
        Returns:
        true if there're anything except hardcoded data in the mask

      • filled

        boolean filled()
        Checks whether th whole mask is filled out.
        Returns:
        true if the're no more empty slots

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes user input from this mask.

      • insertAt

        int insertAt(int position,
             java.lang.CharSequence input,
             boolean cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded)
        Method insert input to the buffer. Only validated characters would be inserted. Hardcoded slots are omitted. Method returns new cursor position that is affected by input and cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded flag. In most cases if input string is followed by a sequence of hardcoded characters we should place cursor after them. But this behaviour can be modified by cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded flag.
        Parameters:
        position - from which position to begin input
        input - string to insert
        cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded - when input is followed by a hardcoded characters sequence then this flag defines whether new cursor position should be after or before them
        Returns:
        cursor position after insert

      • insertAt

        int insertAt(int position,
             java.lang.CharSequence input)
        Convenience method for MaskImpl.insertAt(int, CharSequence, boolean) that always places cursor after trailing hardcoded sequence.
        Parameters:
        position - from which position to begin input
        input - string to insert
        Returns:
        cursor position after insert

      • insertFront

        int insertFront(java.lang.CharSequence input)
        Convenience method for MaskImpl.insertAt(int, CharSequence, boolean) that inserts text at the first position of a mask and always places cursor after trailing hardcoded sequence.
        Parameters:
        input - string to insert
        Returns:
        cursor position after insert

      • removeBackwards

        int removeBackwards(int position,
                    int count)
        Removes available symbols from the buffer. This method should be called on deletion event of user's input. Symbols are deleting backwards (just as backspace key). Hardcoded symbols would not be deleted, only cursor will be moved over them.

        Method also updates showHardcodedTail flag that defines whether tail of hardcoded symbols (at the end of user's input) should be shown. In most cases it should not. The only case when they are visible - buffer starts with them and deletion was inside them.

        Parameters:
        position - from where to start deletion
        count - number of symbols to delete.
        Returns:
        new cursor position after deletion

      • removeBackwardsWithoutHardcoded

        int removeBackwardsWithoutHardcoded(int position,
                                    int count)

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Returns current size of a mask in slots.
        IMPORTANT: empty slots are also counted.
        Returns:
        returns current size of a mask in slots

      • isShowingEmptySlots

        boolean isShowingEmptySlots()
        Returns:
        true if mask allows to display slots with no value, putting placeholder on those positions.

        See: setPlaceholder(Character)

      • setShowingEmptySlots

        void setShowingEmptySlots(boolean showingEmptySlots)
        Defines whether mask allows to display slots with no value, putting placeholder on those positions.

        See: setPlaceholder(Character)
        Parameters:
        showingEmptySlots - true if mask allows empty slots to be displayed

      • getPlaceholder

        java.lang.Character getPlaceholder()
        Returns:
        character that will be put on empty position when calling #toString() or toUnformattedString().

        See: setShowingEmptySlots(boolean)

      • setPlaceholder

        void setPlaceholder(java.lang.Character placeholder)
        Sets character that will be put on empty position when calling #toString() or toUnformattedString(). Placeholder should not be null!

        See: setShowingEmptySlots(boolean)
        Parameters:
        placeholder - character that represents empty slots

      • isHideHardcodedHead

        boolean isHideHardcodedHead()
        Returns:
        true if mask will hide leading hardcoded sequence of its contents.

        See: setHideHardcodedHead(boolean)

      • setHideHardcodedHead

        void setHideHardcodedHead(boolean shouldHideHardcodedHead)
        Defines whether mask should hide leading hardcoded sequence when calling #toString() or toUnformattedString().

        Example of "hardcoded head" is +7 ( in the russian cellphone number mask defined in PredefinedSlots.RUS_PHONE_NUMBER.
        Parameters:
        shouldHideHardcodedHead - the "hide hardcode head" value

      • isForbidInputWhenFilled

        boolean isForbidInputWhenFilled()
        Returns:
        true if mask won't allow to perform further input if all the slots are already filled out.

        See: setForbidInputWhenFilled(boolean)

      • setForbidInputWhenFilled

        void setForbidInputWhenFilled(boolean forbidInputWhenFilled)
        Defines whether mask won't allow to perform further input if all the slots are already filled out. If false passed - mask will shift existing input when trying to insert text inside filled out mask (filled() returns true).

        WARNING: This flag only makes sense for terminated masks.
        Parameters:
        forbidInputWhenFilled - flag that forbids overwriting terminated filled out masks.

      • findCursorPositionInUnformattedString

        int findCursorPositionInUnformattedString(int cursorPosition)
        Finds cursor position in unformatted string that corresponds to passed cursor position in a formatted string.
        Parameters:
        cursorPosition -
        Returns:
        corresponding cursor position in unformatted string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if cursorPosition < 0 or cursorPosition > size
